data.title: Intuit QuickBooks Restaurant Relief Grant Initiative
data.text:
OVERVIEW

The purpose of the Intuit QuickBooks Restaurant Relief Initiative in partnership with the GRA is to support small business growth and grant $100,000 to restaurants in the Atlanta metro area. Through the QuickBooks Restaurant Relief Initiative, restaurants with an annual net revenue of less than $250,000 can apply for a $5,000 grant to cover payroll and operating expenses to help employ and retain staff.

PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION TIMELINE

Application Opens: Wednesday, December 8

Submissions Close: Friday, January 7

Grant Recipient Announcement: Week of January 17

QUALIFICATIONS + EVALUATION OF GRANT APPLICATIONS

COVID-19 has drastically impacted all restaurants. The Georgia Restaurant Association represents all 19,000+ restaurants in Georgia, regardless of ownership, franchise brand, etc. During the establishment of the Intuit QuickBooks Restaurant Relief Initiative in partnership with the GRA, the Georgia Restaurant Association Foundation (GRAF) leadership considered the need of independent restaurateurs and lack of support the resources that nationwide corporate-owned or franchised receive.

QUALIFICATIONS

Restaurant must be located in Georgia

Less than $250,000 in annual net revenue in 2020

The restaurant remains open or providing modified service (takeout/delivery)

APPLICATION EVALUATION

The Restaurant Relief Initiative grant awards evaluated by using a simple rubric:

All application documentation and acknowledgment statement have been submitted

The restaurant is currently open

The restaurant has less than $250,000 in annual net revenue in 2020

Ownership has been confirmed as independent (For the absence of doubt, an independent restaurant is defined as a restaurant owned by a corporation, limited liability partnership, general partnerships, or sole proprietorship, and is not a franchise of a national chain. Independent restaurant chains DO QUALIFY for this grant.)

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Grant money must go towards payroll related expenses â€“ such as: new hire bonuses, performance bonuses, advertising/marketing for new hires, restaurant marketing, rent, equipment, inventory costs, insurance, etc.
